doc.title: Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification

clauses.clause: This directive takes effect on July 8, 2023.
This directive replaces the Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification dated April 1, 2021.
This directive is issued pursuant to the authorities indicated in section 2 of the Policy on the Management of Executives.

The objectives of this directive are as follows: To ensure that organizational design and classification activities in the Executive (EX) Group are well managed; andTo safeguard the integrity of EX Group classification.

The expected results of this directive are as follows: Executive organizational structures are designed and managed to support the delivery of organizational mandates; andEX Group positions are classified consistently across the core public administration.

Heads of human resources are responsible for complying with standards and mandatory procedures associated with the requirements set out in the Appendices of this directive, and: Approving classification actions on behalf of the deputy head;Ensuring the recommendations to the deputy head on the creation and classification of EX Group positions are in accordance with this Directive;Ensuring that classification decisions are documented promptly, accurately and completely in: Classification files;Organizational human resources information management systems; andInformation management systems identified by the Chief Human Resources Officer;Ensuring that employees in the EX Group are notified each time a classification decision is rendered for the position they occupy;Ensuring that persons who provide advice on EX Group classification have experience in classification and have completed the required training on the Executive Group Job Evaluation Standard;Consulting the Office of the Chief Human Resources Officer when a classification decision is contentious, precedent setting, or may impact inter‑organizational relativity;Consulting the Chief Financial Officer when creating or reclassifying any EX-04 and EX-05 positions;Ensuring that positions that have assistant deputy head status are classified in accordance with Appendix C; Ensuring that associate assistant deputy head positions are classified in accordance with Appendix D;Ensuring an internal process is established to review the creation or the reclassification of EX-04 and EX-05 positions; andEnsuring an internal process is established for the resolution of disagreements in EX Group classification decisions.

The Office of the Chief Human Resources Officer is responsible for: Providing advice and guidance on the evaluation of EX Group positions;Providing oversight, monitoring, and reporting activities on the overall health of the Classification Program for EX Group positions; and Informing deputy heads of cases of non-compliance with this Directive, the Policy on the Management of Executives, or with the Executive Group Job Evaluation Standard and directing them to take appropriate corrective actions where required.
The roles of other government organizations in relation to this directive are described in section 5 of the Policy on People Management.
This directive applies to the organizations described in section 6 of the Policy on the Management of Executives.
This directive applies to positions classified in the EX Group in the core public administration.
This directive does not apply to persons appointed by the Governor in Council, to members of the RCMP, or to members of the Canadian Armed Forces.

appendix.title: Appendix A: Standard on Classification for Executive (EX) Group Positions

clauses.clause: This standard provides details on the requirements set out in section 4.1 of the Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification.

appendix.title: Appendix B: Mandatory Procedures for Executive (EX) Group Classification Actions and Decisions

clauses.clause: These procedures provide details on the requirements set out in section 4.1 of the Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification.

Mandatory procedures are as follows: For each classification action and decision, the following actions must be completed: Each classification action and decision must be documented in the classification file in accordance with Appendix A;Data on the classification action and decision must be entered into the organizational human resources information management system; andData and documentation on the classification action and decision must be uploaded to the information management systems identified by the Chief Human Resources Officer.In addition to the procedures described in subsection B.1.2.1, for each reclassification, the following actions must be completed: Job descriptions must be updated and evaluated within one year of changes that result in the reclassification of a position;The evaluation rationale must include a justification for the reclassification of the existing position instead of the creation of a new position, and the effective date;A statement must be included in the classification file that summarizes the evolution of the work; andClassification decisions on the reclassification of occupied positions must be proactively disclosed.

appendix.title: Appendix C: Standard on Positions That Have Assistant Deputy Head Status

clauses.clause: This standard provides details on the requirements set out in subsection 4.1.8 of the Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification.

Standards are as follows: Classified positions that have assistant deputy head status: Report directly to the deputy head or the associate deputy head;Sustain classification at the EX‑04 or EX‑05 level;Are delegated a significant part of the deputy head’s authority;Hold accountability for the results and outcomes of their programs, including the means and resources employed;Reflect full responsibility for advising the deputy head and the Minister on policies for areas they direct;Reflect participation on the organization’s senior management committee;Are delegated a level of signing authority that is second only to the deputy head’s for particular areas of organizational operations and priorities;Have the authority to communicate publicly on their programs and, as required, on all the organization’s activities; andHave titles that reflect the organization’s operating mode and the deputy head’s own title. Such titles include Assistant Deputy Minister, Vice-President, Deputy Commissioner, Deputy Secretary or Assistant Secretary.Classified positions that have senior assistant deputy head titles: Sustain classification at the EX‑05 level and direct an operation that is a major program or function of the organization;Do not impact the deputy head’s delegation of authority to other assistant deputy heads or their accountability to the deputy head; andMay, in exceptional circumstances or to resolve cross‑jurisdictional issues, coordinate the work of other assistant deputy heads to reduce the burden on the deputy head.

appendix.title: Appendix D: Standard on Evaluating Associate Assistant Deputy Head Positions

clauses.clause: This standard provides details on the requirements set out in subsection 4.1.9 of the Directive on Executive (EX) Group Organization and Classification.

Standards are as follows: An associate assistant deputy head position: Must sustain classification at the EX‑04 level;Shares the mandate, delegated authority and accountability of an existing EX‑05 position of exceptional size and complexity where both positions report to the same deputy head or associate deputy head and comprise a single shared point of accountability in a program or policy sector that cannot feasibly be subdivided;Does not constitute an additional hierarchical level below the deputy head or associate deputy head;Is normally limited to a specified period; andThe EX‑05 position is ultimately accountable for all program and policy decisions within the mandate.

appendix.title: Appendix E: Definitions
appendix.p: Definitions to be used in the interpretation of this directive can be found in this appendix, in the Policy on People Management, and in the Policy on the Management of Executives.

dl.dd: A classification activity that does not require a new classification decision and does not have an impact on the position’s surrounding organizational structure.

A decision made by the deputy head, a senior official designated by the deputy head for classification grievances purposes, or an accredited person exercising classification authority, which establishes or confirms the occupational group, subgroup (if applicable), level, or ratings assigned to a job.
dl.dt: Job evaluation rationale (justification de l’évaluation de l’emploi)
dl.dd: A document that substantiates a classification decision as a result of a detailed analysis and evaluation of duties using the appropriate job evaluation standard.
